Kyosho K03193A Mazda Savanna RX-3 1972 Fuji Masters 250km DNF Y. Katayama

Purchased: 2014

(from Japanese Nostalgic Car:)
One of the greatest rivalries from the heyday of Japanese motorsports was that of Nissan versus Mazda. After the Savanna RX-3 snatched Nissanâ€™s much anticipated 50th victory from the Skyline GT-R in December 1971, a blood feud was born. The following year that fight grew even more heated, with roaring rotaries and fierce Hakosukas duking it out throughout the 1972 season.

Katayama was expected to fight for victory in this race after winning the Japan GP earlier in the year. He qualified 3rd, breaking the 2 minute barrier for passenger cars at Fuji (along with 2 other Mazdas). He did lead the race early on but dropped out due to ignition trouble.

Here's a Mazda promotional video setting the scene for the 1972 Fuji Masters Super Touring Race, which pitted RX-2s and 3s against fearsome GT-Rs in a thrilling display of wheeled combat around the 30 degree banks of Fuji Speedway:
1972 Fuji Masters Super Touring Race

As for the model, the quality on this one is the worst of the 4 RX-3s - the right-front fender flare fit is not good at all.
